statements.name: PROC QDEVICE
statements.description: Controls the input data that is examined, the contents of a report, and the type of output to create.
statements.help:
PROC QDEVICE 
	<REPORT=GENERAL | FONT | DEVOPTION | LINESTYLE | RECTANGLE |                         SYMBOL>
	<OUT=SAS-data-set>
	<CATALOG=catalog-name>
	<DEVLOC=GDEVICEn | SASHELP |                         _ALL_ | libref>
	<REGISTRY=SASHELP | SASUSER>
	<SUPPORT=YES | NO | ALL>
	<UNITS=IN | CM;>
	DEVICE <device-name(s)><_ALL_><_HTML_><_LISTING_><_RTF_>; 
	PRINTER  <printer-name(s)><_ALL_><_PCL_><_PDF_><_PRINTER_><_PS_>;
	VAR  variable-1<variable-2 ...>;

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: specifies the name of a SAS device catalog to search for a device.

arguments.name: DEVLOC=
arguments.description: specifies the library or libraries where the device catalog is located.

arguments.name: GDEVICE
arguments.description: specifies to search one of the SAS/GRAPH device libraries for a device. n can be 0–9.

arguments.name: SASHELP
arguments.description: specifies to search the Sashelp library for a device.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: specifies to search the libraries Gdevice0 – Gdevice9 and the Sashelp library, in this order, for a device. All occurrences of a device from any of these libraries are reported.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: specifies a valid SAS library to search.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies an output SAS data set for the report.

arguments.name: REGISTRY=
arguments.description: specifies which section of the SAS registry to search when querying a universal printer.

arguments.name: SASHELP
arguments.description: search the SASHELP section of the registry.

arguments.name: SASUSER
arguments.description: search the SASUSER section of the registry.

arguments.name: REPORT=
arguments.description: specifies the type of report that you want to generate.
arguments.help: REPORT=DEVOPTION | FONT | GENERAL | LINESTYLE | RECTANGLE | SYMBOL

arguments.name: DEVOPTION
arguments.description: produces a report of the hardware device options supported by the specified device.

arguments.name: FONT
arguments.description: produces a report of all system and device-resident fonts supported by the specified device or printer.

arguments.name: GENERAL
arguments.description: produces a report of general information about the specified device or printer. This report includes information such as destination, margin sizes, default font information, resolution, color information, and size by pixels. This is the default report.

arguments.name: LINESTYLE
arguments.description: produces a report of the hardware line styles supported by the specified device.

arguments.name: RECTANGLE
arguments.description: produces a report of the hardware fill types supported by the specified device.

arguments.name: SYMBOL
arguments.description: produces a report of the hardware symbols supported by the specified device.

arguments.name: SUPPORT=
arguments.description: specifies whether to report only supported features, only unsupported features, or all features.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: reports only hardware features and options that are supported.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: reports only the hardware features and options that are not supported.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: reports both supported and unsupported hardware features and options.

arguments.name: UNITS=
arguments.description: specifies whether the values for the certain variables are reported in inches (IN) or centimeters (CM) in the GENERAL report.

statements.name: DEVICE
statements.description: Specifies which SAS/GRAPH devices to generate a report for.

arguments.description: * represents any number of characters in that position of the device name.
? represents one character in the device name. You can specify multiple consecutive ? characters in the device name.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: generates reports for all devices.

arguments.name: _HTML_
arguments.description: determines the default device that is used by the ODS HTML destination and generates a report for that device. The device is based on the default HTML version that is assigned in the ODS key of the SAS registry.

arguments.name: _LISTING_
arguments.description: determines the default device that is used by the ODS Listing destination and generates a report for that device. The default value is a host–specific display device.

arguments.name: _RTF_
arguments.description: determines the default device that is used by the ODS RTF destination and generates a report for that device.

statements.name: PRINTER
statements.description: Specifies which universal printers to generate a report for.

arguments.description: indicates to report all printers that match any number of characters in the position of the * in the printer name.

indicates to report all printers that match the printer name, where the character in the ? position can be any character. You can use multiple ? characters in printer-name to represent the same number of characters in the same position in the printer name.

arguments.name: _ALL_
arguments.description: generates reports for all universal printers.

arguments.name: _PCL_
arguments.description: determines the default printer that is used by the ODS PCL destination and generates a report for that printer.

arguments.name: _PDF_
arguments.description: determines the default printer that is used by the ODS PDF destination and generates a report for that printer.

arguments.name: _PRINTER_
arguments.description: determines the default printer that is used by the ODS PRINTER destination and generates a report for that printer.

arguments.name: _PS_
arguments.description: determines the default printer that is used by the ODS PS destination and generates a report for that printer.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: Specifies which variables to include in a report. The order of the variables in the report is determined by the order in which they are specified in the VAR statement.

arguments.name: ALIAS
arguments.description: reports an alternate name for a font that is registered by the FONTREG procedure.

arguments.name: ANIMATION
arguments.description: specifies whether animation is active, enabled, disabled, or unsupported for a Universal Printer:

arguments.name: BIT
arguments.description: displays the bit position in the DEVOPTS string for the corresponding device option.

arguments.name: BITSTRING
arguments.description: displays the bit pattern of the corresponding device option.

arguments.name: BMIN
arguments.description: displays the minimum size of the bottom margin.

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: displays the current size of bottom margin.

arguments.name: CLRSPACE
arguments.description: displays the type of color support (color space) such as RGB, RGBA, CMYK, HLS, and so on.

arguments.name: COLS
arguments.description: displays the number of horizontal columns in the output.

arguments.name: COMPRESSION
arguments.description: indicates the condition under which compression is used. Compression can always be in effect, in effect only when specified by a compression option, or never used by the device or printer.

arguments.name: COMPMETHOD
arguments.description: indicates the compression method that is used if compression is supported by device or printer.

arguments.name: DESC
arguments.description: displays the default description of the device or printer.

arguments.name: DEST
arguments.description: displays the default destination of the device or universal printer if the device or printer does not send output directly to a printer or a display device. If the device sends output directly to a printer or a display device, the value of DEST is blank.

arguments.name: EMBEDDING
arguments.description: indicates whether font embedding is supported.

arguments.name: FHEIGHT
arguments.description: displays the height, in the respective units, of the default font.

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: displays the hardware fill types that are supported by the device.

arguments.name: FONT
arguments.description: displays the name of the default font.

arguments.name: FORMAT
arguments.description: displays the output format type (for example, EMF, EMF Plus, EMF Dual, PostScript, GIF, Host Display, and so on).

arguments.name: FSTYLE
arguments.description: displays the font style, such as Roman or Italic, for each font and font weight, in an output data set.

arguments.name: FTYPE
arguments.description: displays the type of font, such as Printer Resident, System, or Software.

arguments.name: FVERSION
arguments.description: specifies the font version.

arguments.name: FWEIGHT
arguments.description: displays the font weight, such as Normal or Bold, for each font and font style, in an output data set.

arguments.name: HEIGHT
arguments.description: displays the default vertical height of output (in UNITS) sent to the device or printer.

arguments.name: HRES
arguments.description: displays the horizontal resolution (pixels per UNIT) of output sent to the device or printer. Horizontal resolution is calculated by the formula HRES=XPIXELS/WIDTH.

arguments.name: IOTYPE
arguments.description: displays the type of input/output used by the device or printer (for example, DISK, PRINTER, PIPE, GTERM, and so on).

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: displays the size of the left margin of output.

arguments.name: LINE
arguments.description: displays the line styles supported by the device or printer.

arguments.name: LMIN
arguments.description: displays the minimum left margin.

arguments.name: LOCATION
arguments.description: for the device entry that was found, displays the physical location of the Gdevice0-Gdevice9 library, the Sashelp library, or the library that is specified by the DEVLOC= option. For universal printers, this variable displays the SAS registry (SASHELP or SASUSER) where the printer was found.

arguments.name: MAXCOLORS
arguments.description: displays the maximum number of colors that are supported by the device or printer.

arguments.name: MODULE
arguments.description: specifies the name of the device driver module.

arguments.name: NAME
arguments.description: displays the name of the device or printer.

arguments.name: ODESC
arguments.description: displays the descriptions of the hardware options in effect for the device.

arguments.name: OPTION
arguments.description: displays the names of the hardware options in effect for the device.

arguments.name: PROTOTYPE
arguments.description: displays the prototype (model) that was used to define the universal printer.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: displays the size of the right margin.

arguments.name: RMIN
arguments.description: displays the minimum size of the right margin.

arguments.name: ROWS
arguments.description: displays the number of vertical rows in the output.

arguments.name: SUPPORT
arguments.description: displays the device options.

arguments.name: SYMBOL
arguments.description: specifies the name of hardware symbols.

arguments.name: TMIN
arguments.description: displays the minimum top margin of output.

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: displays the size of the top margin.

arguments.name: TYPE
arguments.description: displays the type of device or printer.

arguments.name: UNITS
arguments.description: displays the units (IN for inches or CM for centimeters) in which sizes are displayed. In the SAS log, the value of UNITS appears respectively, as inches or centimeters. In an output data set, the value of UNITS appears as IN or CM.

arguments.name: VISUAL
arguments.description: displays the visual color type (for example, Indexed Color, Direct Color, True Color, Monochrome, or Gray Scale).

arguments.name: VRES
arguments.description: displays the vertical resolution (pixels per UNIT) of output sent to the device or printer.

arguments.name: WIDTH
arguments.description: displays the width of output (in UNITS) sent to device or printer.

arguments.name: XPIXELS
arguments.description: displays the width of the output in pixels.

arguments.name: YPIXELS
arguments.description: displays the height of the output in pixels.
